catalog_info.title: Logic and Philosophy
catalog_info.notes: Friday class meetings will be held at the discretion of the instructor.
catalog_info.description: Three philosophically important results of modern logic: Gödel’s incompleteness theorems; Turing’s definition of mechanical computability; Tarski’s theory of truth for formalized languages. Discusses both mathematical content and philosophical significance of these results.Prerequisite: Some knowledge of deductive logic.
